title: Traumatic Brain Injury Case Study: Alex's Story
clinical_history: Alex, a 25-year-old male, was involved in a motor vehicle accident and suffered a moderate traumatic brain injury (TBI). He was hospitalized for 10 days and underwent rehabilitation for several months. Currently, Alex experiences persistent headaches, fatigue, and difficulty with concentration and memory. He also reports dizziness and imbalance, which have limited his ability to participate in daily activities and return to work.
aggrevating_factors: prolonged mental effort, physical exertion, and exposure to bright lights or loud noises
picture: A 24-hour picture of Alex's symptoms shows that his headaches and fatigue worsen throughout the day, with increased sensitivity to light and noise in the afternoon.
past_history: No significant past medical or surgical history
medical_history: CT scan and MRI revealed a diffuse axonal injury with no evidence of hemorrhage or mass effect
medications: Acetaminophen as needed for headaches, and ondansetron for nausea
personal_history: Alex is a graduate student who was on leave due to his injury. He lives alone and has a strong support system from his family and friends.
imaging: CT and MRI scans of the brain
